attributes.action: Change the national anthem from God Save The Queen to Three Lions
attributes.additional_details:
It may have been popular when it was first made the national anthem but for each generation that comes along they don't even know 2 lines too the song. 
You see people singing God Save The Queen and there's no joy, no passion, absolutely no patriarchy to the song not even a smile. However, everyone knows and loves Three Lions. 
Imagine a packed out stadium with everyone in there singing that song with a smile on their face and passion in their heart.
attributes.background: Whenever it comes to singing the national anthem, God Save The Queen it should be replaced with the Three Lions by David Baddiel, Frank Skinner, and The Lightning Seeds.

rejection.details:
This isn’t something that the UK Government or Parliament would be able to do. The use of the present National Anthem is a matter of tradition rather than having any legal or constitutional status.

You can find more information about the history and status of the national anthem here:

https://www.royal.uk/national-anthem
